title: Case Manager
description:
At Gilead, we’re creating a healthier world for all people. For more than 35 years, we’ve tackled diseases such as HIV, viral hepatitis, COVID-19 and cancer – working relentlessly to develop therapies that help improve lives and to ensure access to these therapies across the globe. We continue to fight against the world’s biggest health challenges, and our mission requires collaboration, determination and a relentless drive to make a difference.Every member of Gilead’s team plays a critical role in the discovery and development of life-changing scientific innovations. Our employees are our greatest asset as we work to achieve our bold ambitions, and we’re looking for the next wave of passionate and ambitious people ready to make a direct impact.We believe every employee deserves a great leader. People Leaders are the cornerstone to the employee experience at Gilead and Kite. As a people leader now or in the future, you are the key driver in evolving our culture and creating an environment where every employee feels included, developed and empowered to fulfil their aspirations. Join Gilead and help create possible, together.Job DescriptionSpecific Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for monitoring Kite Konnect program.Collaborates with other key Gilead team members to establish and manage contracted relationships with select specialty distributors and specialty pharmacies.Works closely with Regulatory, Legal, Com Ops and other partners/stakeholders to ensure fully compliant practices, policies & procedures both internally and with vendor.Provides input on partner selection based on core capabilities, market presence, and likely Gilead business value.Contributes to criteria and reporting required for new programs in order to support new product launches while continually reviewing existing programs and evaluating additional development needed.Investigates and responds to internal and external customer complaints while concurrently instituting necessary improvements to avoid recurrence.Produces accurate, timely and insightful management reports regarding program trends.Provides substantive analysis that accurately incorporates the partnership agreements and the projected financial impact.Considers the need to audit external vendors to ensure compliance of agreement and policies.Specific Education & Experience Requirements:
10+ years of related experience in biotech or pharmaceuticals industry and a BS or BA degree, including leadership experience in executing trade management activities.Knowledge:
English fluency is mandatoryAbility to multi-task across a wide variety of tactical and strategic activities.Able to effectively manage others in accomplishing necessary tasks, both direct reports and others in related areas of Gilead.Able to influence and provide recommendations to senior management.Ability to recognize and interpret business issues/opportunities and recommend solutions through analysis, then implement and/or negotiate solutions with external parties.Excellent analytical skills with an emphasis on follow-through, and issue resolution abilities.Microsoft Excel/Word & PowerPoint and strong working knowledge of order management and information management systems.For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:
Please apply via the Internal Career Opportunities portal in Workday.Share:
Job Requisition ID R0044833Full Time/Part Time Full-TimeJob Level Associate#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior Core Network Engineer
description:
About the Role:
We are looking for a Sr. Technical Engineer with a solid background in Core Network (CS Core & VAS) and working knowledge of PS Core to join our client, a leading global player in the telecommunications sector. You will provide L2 support for critical telecom platforms, including signaling protocols, billing, charging systems, and value-added services (VAS), ensuring high service availability and incident resolution for enterprise clients.This is a hands-on role with direct interaction with customers, internal engineering teams, and vendors. The ideal candidate has strong troubleshooting skills, Core/VAS expertise, and a proactive, service-oriented mindset.Key Responsibilities:
Provide L2 troubleshooting and diagnostics for Core Network and VAS platforms (CS/PS).Analyze, resolve, and document technical incidents, ensuring minimal downtime for the customer.Support emergency situations under 24/7 on-call rotations.Organize and participate in technical bridge calls with customer and internal teams.Coordinate with internal teams (L1, L3, NOC) and external partners (MNOs, ISPs, ILD/NLD carriers).Implement temporary workarounds and follow through with permanent fixes (RCA).Assist in deployment/configuration of hardware, virtual machines, OS, RAID, HA modules.On-site coordination (if needed) for structured cabling, rack mounting, powering, IP allocation, etc.Maintain updated documentation of contact details, platform configurations, known issues, and SOPs.Ensure SLAs are consistently met or exceeded.Required Technical Skills:
Core Network Protocols (CS & PS):
CS Core:
MAP, CAMEL, INAP, SMPP, SS7/SIGTRANPS Core:
Diameter, GPRS, knowledge of PCRF, OCSValue-Added Services (VAS):
SMSC, MMSC, voicemail, billing, and charging platformsNetwork Elements:
OCS, PCRF, Kafka, Zookeeper, TomcatCDR & Billing Analysis:
Strong understanding of telecom CDRs and charging flowsOperating Systems & Scripting:
Linux/Solaris (mandatory), Shell scriptingPython scripting (preferred)Databases:
Oracle, MySQL – strong skills in SQL queries and troubleshootingTools & Platforms:
Wireshark, Postman, Jenkins, AnsibleAPI Integration:
Familiarity with REST APIs and automated workflow testingCandidate Profile:
Bachelor’s Degree in Telecommunications, Computer Science, Electronics, or a related field4–6 years of experience in a similar L2 support role in a telecom operator or managed services environmentProven experience in incident management, RCA documentation, and cross-functional collaborationAdvanced English (B2/C1) – mandatory for daily communication with U.S. clientsPreferred Skills (Nice to Have):
Exposure to 3G/4G/5G core environmentsFamiliarity with edge computing, IoT applications, or AI-driven telecom platformsExperience supporting hybrid cloud/on-prem infrastructure

title: Software Engineer Ii
description:
Carta develops purpose-built software that transforms traditional accounting into a powerful growth engine.Carta’s world-class fund administration platform supports nearly 7,000 funds and SPVs, and represents nearly $130B in assets under management in venture capital and private equity.Trusted by more than 40,000 companies, Carta also helps private businesses in over 160 countries manage their cap tables, valuations, taxes, equity programs, compensation, and more.Together, Carta is setting a new standard as the end-to-end platform for private markets. Our best-in-class solution for fund management seamlessly integrates investor and portfolio company insights via a suite of tools designed ground-up to support the strategic impact of the fund CFO.At Carta, our employees set out on a mission to unlock the power of equity ownership for more people in more places. We believe that the problems we solve today unlock the opportunities of tomorrow. Here is an incomplete list of how you might contribute:
Building customer-facing enterprise tools for equity administrationCreating data pipelines for asynchronously aggregating financial reportsReinforcing service resiliency, availability, and fault toleranceStreamlining the creation of new features and services within our ecosystemIntegrating with third-party vendors to provide reliable, accurate, and timely transfers of billions of dollars per year through Carta's platformRefactoring existing features into standalone event-driven servicesYou'll work directly with internal and external stakeholders to ensure we're building the right thing at the right time with the right people. Your contributions will enable Carta's mission to make equity more available and accessible to everyone.The Team You’ll Work WithYou will join our engineering team of passionate learners, builders, experts, and leaders to define and implement Carta's next generation of products, platforms, and infrastructure. You'll collaborate closely with key stakeholders in Product, Business, and Design. Carta's software engineers contribute in many different ways:
sometimes we are shipping new product features, architecting simple and maintainable systems, or training the organization on new technology solutions. You will make your own mark here. Here are some of the teams we’re hiring for:
Transactions - The Transactions team is dedicated to simplifying and accelerating equity liquidity for private companies. We help issuers provide liquidity opportunities through tender offers, enabling employees to unlock the value of their equity awards.Investor Access - The Investor Access team enhances the connection between investors and their portfolio companies by providing timely and accurate access to investment data. We work closely with leading investment firms to streamline data management and ensure security, all while delivering a seamless user experience.About YouAt Carta, you’re not just an employee. You’re a builder who is creating infrastructure that accelerates innovation and empowers more ownership. Cartans are helpful, relentless, unconventional and kind;
representing Carta’s Identity Traits. They work collaboratively and cross-functionally to challenge the status quo;
working towards a common goal of creating more owners in the private markets.You have 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer.You have strong technical skills and are an excellent collaborator.You implement systems that are clear, maintainable, and correct.You are excited by opportunities to both break ground on new projects and provide fresh perspective onto past implementations.You want to build and own your work end-to-end.You are eager to move fast, but recognize when to build for the future.The Interview ProcessFirst, one of our recruiters will call you to tell you more about the job and company. You'll then meet an Engineering leader who will discuss your opportunities at Carta and explore your experience, skills, and goals. We’ll then ask you to show off your skills with a real-world take home exercise. Finally, you'll have back-to-back conversations with Carta team members on a wide range of topics, including communications and collaboration, coding efficacy and techniques, and systems design.We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, please connect with the talent partner via email.Apply for this jobPlease note the listed location for this role is:
Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. This role is located in Rio de Janeiro. We work in a hybrid model where we go into our office 3x/week and work remotely the remaining 2 days.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Professional Services Consultant
description:
Professional Services ArchitectAs customers security infrastructure become more complex, Fortinet Professional Services experts are positioned to help them every step of the way. We’ve accumulated many years of experience to help our customers with their security design, deployment, operation, and optimization needs. The Professional Services Architect is a key member of the LATAM Professional Services organization, serving as a customer facing technical point of contact guiding and overseeing technical aspects during solution, transition, and delivery phases. This role involves providing services delivery expertise to ensure a correct solution leading to a smooth transition of systems and processes, aligning with architecture principles. The successful candidate will primarily work from home but must be available to go on-site with clients when needed. Working hours are flexible Monday – Friday, with occasional after-hours to accompany customers maintenance windows and go-livesSkills & QualificationsSolid technical expertise in system architecture and design.Ability to study and solve complex technical challenges.Familiarity with cybersecurity hardware, systems and infrastructure.Detail-oriented with a structured approach to problem solving.Experience in developing SOWs, LLD HLDs.Scripting is a plus.Bachelor's / University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.Proven experience as a Professional Services Architect, Consultant or Pre-Sales Engineer.In-depth knowledge of enterprise architecture principles and transitional methodologies.Relevant industry experience in NGFW and at least 4 of the following technologies:
Email Security, Advanced Threat Protection, Endpoint Security, Application Security, Web Application Firewall, Network Security Management, SIEM, Network Virtualization, Software Defined Networks (SDN) and/or other cloud-based technologies.Proficiency in verbal and written communication in Portuguese, English and SpanishJob Duties and ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand business requirements and technical constraints during solution, transitional and delivery phases.Provide remote and onsite technical consulting expertise in the development of the solution, transition, and delivery strategies, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture principles.Test existing systems and processes, identifying technical requirements and potential challenges during both transition and delivery.Support the design and architect solutions, considering scalability, security, and efficiency.Work closely with project teams to ensure the implementation of the solutions aligns with the overall strategy.Conduct reviews and assessments to ensure compliance with architecture principles and best practices.Provide guidance and support to development teams during the implementation of solutions.Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior Control & Automation Engineer
description:
Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:
TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration – and we want you to be part of it. You’ll be joining a culture that values curiosity, expertise, and ideas as well as diversity, inclusion, and authenticity. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go.Job PurposeThe Senior Automation Engineer is responsible for working with our customers to design solutions to control, monitor, and automate their industrial processes. At the senior level, it is expected to demonstrate the ability to manage customer expectations and product quality from tendering through the life of the field. This includes design and configuration of control systems of varying complexity and coaching peers in good design and best practices. The candidate must demonstrate process and project management skills to function effectively with customers, peers, and the product development team.Job DescriptionArchitect, design, implement, unit test, and deliver high-quality, performant software applications.Work cross-functionally with software, application, and quality engineers to ensure products meet engineering and client success criteria.Actively participate in the definition and implementation of new processes and improvements.Identify and create new technologies and ideas to increase the organization’s intellectual property and better address customer needs.Present your designs and solutions to internal and external teams and review designs of software and quality engineers.Coordinate with QA team to develop test plans and test automation processes to increase automated functional tests.Mentor team members in development technologies, tools, and processes.You are meant for this job if:
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Electronic, Controls & Automation, Mechatronics, Chemical, Electrical, Computer Science, or equivalent Engineering, with a focus on industrial process control.Active CREA certification.Proficient in English.Experience in developing automated applications or research involving process automation.Experience with configuration and design of industrial control systems on hardware, software, or modeling side.Ability to design, review, and implement both software and hardware components of control systems from instrumentation to HMI.Understanding of dynamics within linear and non-linear systems, especially upstream oil and gas processes.Ability to produce project documentation according to international standards and customer requirements, and present it for approval.Knowledge of industrial protocols such as Modbus, Profibus, serial, etc., and their applications.Advanced experience with multiple text and visual programming languages.Experience with Python programming is highly desirable.SkillsAdditional SkillsAct with agility.Problem-solving skills.Data-driven decision-making.TechnipFMC promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion by ensuring equal opportunities for all, regardless of age, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, disabilities, or other differences. We celebrate your individuality and encourage you to contribute to our culture.We respect the rights and dignity of all individuals and promote adherence to internationally recognized human rights principles within our value chain.Learn more about TechnipFMC and explore other open positions on our Career Page.Follow us on LinkedIn for company updates.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Meta & Linkedin Ad Specialist
description:
Hey, Dingus!Yeah, you heard that right. Dingus & Zazzy is looking for a Meta & Ad Specialist to join our growing team!About UsDingus & Zazzy is a comprehensive digital marketing agency offering services for brands looking to expand their presence across a variety of digital platforms. Our business is expanding globally, and we need talented folks on our team to continue offering stellar service to our clients.Running a company is a little like building a plane while flying it. There’s always too much to do;
doing one thing means neglecting something else. You have to blog, but also be active on social media. You have to build websites and then optimize them for mobile. Email lists. Emails. Keywords. SEM. SEO. UX. UI. FML. OMG. That’s where we come in. We provide an unlimited get-shit-done subscription for our clients. And we need your help!About the RoleWant to make a real impact with Meta and ads alongside a cool team that actually gets things done? We’re seeking a motivated person to jump into the exciting world of paid social and professional advertising. You’ll play a key role in building and refining campaigns to help our clients reach their target audience and get tangible results. If you’re looking for a supportive place to learn and grow, we’d love to hear from you!What You’ll DoCreate and manage ad campaigns on Meta and based on each client’s goals and audienceResearch audiences on both platforms to figure out who we should be targeting (demographics, interests, job titles, etc.)Set and adjust ad budgets to get the best results for the money spentUse different targeting options like custom and lookalike audiences, interests, job roles, and industriesWatch how ads are performing and make changes to improve results (e.G., engagement, conversions, cost per lead)Run A/B tests on different ads, targeting, and landing pages to see what works bestSet up tools like Meta Pixel and Insight Tag to track results and understand what’s driving conversionsShare easy-to-understand reports with your team and clients that explain what’s working, what’s not, and what to do nextKeep up with updates and changes on both platforms, and apply what you learn to improve campaign performanceWork closely with the media team, account managers, and creatives to keep everything alignedHelp document processes and share what’s working across the teamKeep campaign info and data organized and easy to accessWhat We’re Looking ForExperience running and improving ad campaigns on both Meta and Comfortable using Meta Ads Manager and Campaign ManagerKnows how to target the right people on each platform (by job title, industry, interests, etc.)Can track performance and make smart decisions based on the dataHas used tracking tools like Meta Pixel and Insight TagStrong problem-solving skills and attention to detailGood at managing time, staying organized, and communicating clearlyCan work solo and with a teamEnglish fluency (written and spoken)Certifications from Meta or are a plusA degree is nice, but solid experience matters moreBonus PointsYou’ve used ad automation or bid management toolsYou’ve worked with other platforms like Google AdsYou’ve worked at an agency beforeOur operating hours are from 9 am to 5 pm MST, Monday to Friday.Ready for the ride of your life? If you think you’re the perfect fit for the role, apply today!

title: Associate - Fund Administration (Fund Accounting) - Hedge Daily
description:
This role is based in our office in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.As an Associate, youwillreport to the Senior Associate Director.The Associateis responsible for ensuring the accuracy and integrity of financial data thorough reconciliations and detailed reporting for complex fund structures. This role requires a deep understanding of portfolio systems and involves collaboration with various internal teams to support client deliverables, manage system upgrades, and maintain operational efficiency.From a high-level perspective, the core responsibilities that form your role are broken down into the following 8 categories:
1. Reconciliation and Reporting2. Data Management and Query Resolution3. Client Communication4. System Management and Upgrades5. Operational Support6. Client Implementation Support7. Continuous Improvement8. Risk and Compliance ResponsibilitiesYour Daily TasksThe following are the tasks linked to the Core Responsibilities that will be expected as part of this role:
1. Reconciliation and Reporting:
Includes (but not limited to) the following tasks:
A. Comprehensive Reconciliations:
Conduct thorough reconciliations of cash, positions, interests, expenses, and corporate actions, comparing data from clients, brokers, custodians, and other sources.B. Detailed Reporting:
Generate and support T+1 reconciliations for clients, ensuring that cash, market value, security-related events, and corporate actions align between our Portfolio System and counterparty information.C. Development of Templates:
Create new reconciliation templates using data management tools to enhance efficiency and accuracy in reporting.2. Data Management and Query Resolution:
Includes (but are not limited to) the following tasks:
A. Data Monitoring:
Assist with data entry and closely monitor trades, prices, and security-related data, addressing and resolving exceptions as needed.B. System Query Resolution:
Tackle system-based queries impacting the accuracy of position and P&L valuations, ensuring timely and effective resolution.3. Client Communication:
Includes (but are not limited to) the following tasks:
A. Reporting to Clients:
Prepare and deliver comprehensive reports to clients on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis as required, ensuring clarity and accuracy.B. Advocacy and Support:
Collaborate with team members to act as advocates for clients within Catalyst, ensuring all deliverables meet the Administration Service Agreement and Service Level Agreements.4. System Management and UpgradesIncludes (but are not limited to) the following tasks:
A. System Upgrades Participation:
Participate in workstreams focused on system upgrades and maintenance of Advent Geneva and other data management applications.B. Pricing Workflow Management:
Oversee the automated pricing process, troubleshoot issues, and establish new pricing workflows, including setups for MarkIt, BVAL, and other pricing vendors.5. Operational SupportIncludes (but are not limited to) the following tasks:
A. Operations Delivery Calendar:
Maintain the Operations delivery calendar to ensure timely delivery of daily fund administration products and services.B. Audit Preparation:
Assist in managing the year-end audit and financial statement preparation process for all assigned funds, assisting with auditors and internal teams.C. Board Meeting Reports:
Contribute to the preparation of reports for the Fund’s Board of Directors meetings, ensuring all necessary information is presented accurately.6. Client Implementation SupportIncludes (but not limited to) the following tasks:
A. Collaboration for System Setups:
Work closely with Client Implementation and operations teams to facilitate system setups, interface programming, and portfolio reporting for client deliverables.7. Continuous ImprovementIncludes (but not limited to) the following tasks:
A. Ad-Hoc Support:
Provide day-to-day support for ad-hoc requests from clients and internal teams, demonstrating a proactive approach to client service.B. Process Development:
Share insights to drive the development of new processes and procedures that enhance business efficiency and support exceptional client service.C. Industry Awareness:
Stay informed about industry, regulatory, and jurisdictional trends that could impact the business, and contribute to the creation and implementation of new products and solutions to meet evolving client needs.8. Risk and Compliance Responsibilities:
Includes (but not limited to) the following tasks:
A. Compliance Tasks:
Perform routine compliance checks and adhere to company risk and compliance processes and policies.B. Record Keeping:
Maintain organized records of compliance documents and reports.C. Assistance in Audits:
Provide support during internal audits and compliance reviews.D. Research Support:
Assist in research for compliance-related queries and regulatory information.E. Learning and Development:
Engage in learning opportunities to understand compliance principles and regulations.Additional Strategic Expectations· Share insights to enable development of new processes and procedures that will create business efficiency and support delivery of client excellence in service.· Contribute to the creation, development and implementation of new products and solutions to accommodate the businesses continuous changing needs.· Collaborate cross-functionally with operations staff, business users, project, and implementation managers to achieve desired and elegant solutions.Required Skills & ExperienceAre you getting excited? Weare! Beforewe get too carried away, there are a few requirements you’ll need to check off before you can apply for the position:
· At least 1 - 3 years' experience with offshore Fund Administration or in a similar role.· BSc or BA, in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or similar field.· Previous experience with financial derivatives pricing and accounting (desirable).· Previous experience with data management.· The candidate must be an energetic professional.· Innovator & self-starter with high energy and drive.· Proactive, taking initiative to identify and address challenges before they become problems.· Effective communicator, able to convey ideas and information clearly and convincingly.· Fluent in English (writing & speaking).#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Líder De Seleções
description:
Coordenar e operacionalizar as atividades para atendimento as categorias que participam das Seleções Olímpicas e Paralímpicas, adulta e de base, viabilizando todo o processo administrativo da área de Seleções da CBTM. Deve providenciar as condições necessárias para que atletas e demais integrantes da comitiva cumpram satisfatoriamente o cronograma planejado de competições, treinamentos ou programas específicos.Nível de reporte:
Diretor Esportivo >
>
>
Gerência TécnicaSuperior Completo em Educação Física, Esporte ou Administração. Conhecimento técnico sobre logística esportiva.Experiência Mínima:
3 anos.Especialização em Gestão e Marketing Esportivo (análogo ou superior). Inglês fluente.Conhecimentos e Experiência:
Pacote Office Avançado. Ferramentas de gestão de projetos. Experiência em organização logística de delegações. Conhecimento sobre a legislação em vigor e as normativas de organismos públicos e de controle.AtividadesPrincipais:
Estruturar todo o processo de treinamento e participações em competições para as categorias de atletas da CBTM, providenciando as condições necessárias a realização dos eventos conforme cronograma de competições. Viabilizar o acesso dos atletas às competições nacionais e internacionais, providenciando a logística necessária a inscrição, viagens, hospedagens, uniformes etc. Orçar as despesas, preparando os documentos e as planilhas de custeio para solicitação de verbas que permitam a participação nos eventos de acordo com as necessidades da entidade. Preparar o planejamento anual de eventos, orçando as despesas dos projetos levando em consideração as categorias, localidades, quantidade de participantes etc. Convocar os atletas selecionados e que irão participar das competições e providenciar as condições necessárias às participações. Manter o site da entidade atualizado com as informações referentes às competições e participações dos atletas. Acompanhar e avaliar as publicações de matérias referentes aos eventos e atletas, garantido a exatidão dos conteúdos. Preparar as informações referentes aos pedidos de verba inserindo no site os dados correspondentes aos recursos materiais e humanos previstos para o evento. Esclarecer as solicitações do COB e CPB sobre as divergências nos valores de prestação de contas, levantando as informações necessárias e os respetivos documentos. Dar suporte ao processo de prestação de contas Prestar informações sobre os atletas e técnicos beneficiados por bolsas dos órgãos públicos acompanhando e controlando as atividades e os relatórios de cada um para envio às Instituições. Controlar as bolsas dos atletas concedidas para participação em eventos nacionais, internacionais e olímpicos, acompanhando às atividades de cada um. Providenciar a compra de uniformes, equipamentos e material da comissão técnica, efetuando cotações junto aos fornecedores homologados, e negociando as condições de compras. Preparar as condições para realização do programa de identificação de talentos, programando os eventos nas regiões indicadas, convocando atletas, e avaliando o desempenho dos candidatos a serem selecionados. Identificar junto à direção da CBTM a necessidade de realização de cursos de treinamentos para capacitação de novos técnicos, providenciando a realização dos ITTF nos diversos níveis. Dar suporte aos atletas avulsos, providenciando técnicos e demais condições de participação nos eventos. Acompanhar os critérios de convocação dos atletas, controlando as participações e resultados. Moderar e conduzir reuniões com a comunidade técnica e científica nas atividades de busca de melhorias no esporte de tênis de mesa. Vistoriar e supervisionar as condições de funcionamento o Centro de Treinamento em São Paulo. Lançar em sistemas de controle de processos/projetos as informações referentes às atividades realizadas para acompanhamento e atualização. Revisar as normas referentes às suas atividades, a fim de atender ao programa de melhoria contínua de produtividade. Subsidiar a Direção e Gerência, fornecendo as informações técnicas para o melhor acompanhamento e controle da área.Organizado, metódico, proativo, bom relacionamento interpessoal, boa comunicação oral e escrita.Regime de contratação CLTVale Refeição ou AlimentaçãoPlano Saúde coparticipação e Plano odontológico (após 03 (três) meses da data de admissão).Local de atuação:

Todos os direitos reservados.Telefone:
(21) 2579-0650 | Atendimento:

22281-050 - Rio de Janeiro/RJ#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Operador De Clad I
description:
Objetivo do cargo Responsável por operar máquinas de soldagem automática, processo CLAD, na unidade de Well Control Manufacturing e Subsea Service da TFMC, visando à soldagem de colos de baixa e média complexidade, de acordo com o desenho e plano de fabricação (desenhos, croquis de solda e PFM), utilizando fatores pré-estabelecidos (EPS / WPS), e instrumentos de medição adequados, visando confeccionar peças com qualidade no menor tempo possível e de acordo com a documentação e procedimentos estabelecidos. Descrição do cargo Realizar a soldagem de peças com baixo/médio valor agregado;
Preparar setup de máquina, fazer cálculos para determinação de parâmetros de soldagem, inserindo-os na máquina;
Acompanhar o processo de soldagem fazendo ajustes/acertos quando necessário e reiniciando o ciclo de soldagem conforme desenho de solda;
Medir camada de solda depositada e observar qualidade da camada (inspeção visual);
Providenciar limpeza da peça usando equipamentos pneumáticos (esmeris) e monitorar pré aquecimento conforme EPS;
Preencher check list de processo clad garantindo a qualidade do produto soldado;
Realizar apontamentos da operação de soldagem conforme o PFM (plano de fabricação e montagem);
Realizar apontamento de monitoramento de horas produtivas e improdutivas;
Realizar a movimentação da peça a ser soldada usando ponte rolante, utilizando instrumentos e dispositivos para executar serviço com segurança e qualidade;
Manter condições básicas de manutenção e limpeza dos equipamentos do setor. Você é ideal para esta oportunidade se:
Formação 2º Grau (Desejável técnico em soldagem);
Desejável inglês básico;
Curso de Soldagem TIG e/ou MIG/MAG;
Experiência em processo de soldagem TIG e/ou MIG/MAG;
Conhecimento de medição e interpretação de desenho;
Conhecimento de simbologia de soldagem;
Desejável conhecimentoem informática (Pacote Office / ABB MES);
Desejável conhecimentoem Lean Manufacturing;
Desejável no Sistema deExecução de Fabricação (MES). Trabalho em Equipe Trabalho em equipe;
Flexibilidadeem trabalho de turnos e trabalhos extras nos finais de semana;
Comunicação eficaz;
Desenvoltura para resolver problemas;

title: Engenharia De Dados Aws Sênior - Id 123360
description:
Sobre a vagaCom mais de 35 anos de mercado e localizada em 16 países, a GFT emprega mais de 10.000 pessoas ao redor do mundo sendo 3.000 pessoas no Brasil.Aqui, a diversidade, a igualdade e a inclusão estão no centro e garantir um ambiente de trabalho seguro para todas as pessoas faz parte de quem somos.Promovemos uma cultura de desenvolvimento e crescimento pautadas no nosso pilar de Continuous Scaled Learning porque acreditamos o uso inteligente da tecnologia é a chave para o sucesso nesse mundo digital.O que estamos buscando?Engenharia de Dados AWS Sênior - ID 123360Requisitos:
Gestão de estruturas de dados, definição de modelos e padrões logidos de dados como unica fonte de informação (data lake com governança de dados );
Desenvolvimento Python;
Experiencia em coleta, transformação e carga de dados (ferramentas de ETL );
Experiência em trabalhar com grandes volumes de dados;
Modelagem de Banco de Dados (SQL, Hadoop, MySQL, Redshift, );
Conhecimento em bancosNoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB );
Integração de dados comoutros sistemas Plataforma AWS;
Experiência em workloads de missão crítica;
Containers (Docker, ECS, Kubernetes, EKS Openshift);
DevOps (Gitlab;
Gitlab CI, Puppet);
Cloudformation (Code Build, CodePipeline) Softwares Necessários:
API Gateway. Kafka. AWS Lake Formation. AWS Banco de Dados (Redshift, MySQL, Dynam DB,..). AWS Athena. AWS GLUE ( Crawlers, Jobs, workflow). AWS Quick Sigth. AWS EMR. AWS Lambda. Profissional especializado em organizar, coletar e processar (ferramentas ETL) experiência com grandes volumes de dados (Data Lake e Data Mesh), traduzindo os objetivos de negócios do cliente em uma estratégia de gerenciamento de informações e inteligência de negócios. Será responsável por manter os pipelines de dados e garantir a segurança no acesso as informações. DataDog, Azure Monitor, CloudWatch).Utilizar bancos de dados não relacionais, como MongoDB ou DynamoDB.Participar de pipelines de CI/CD, garantindo entregas contínuas e seguras.Trabalhar com tecnologias de containerização e orquestração, como Docker e Kubernetes.Utilizar serviços em nuvem (AWS, Azure, etc.), incluindo funções serverless e mensageria.Colaborar em projetos via Azure DevOps, utilizando boards, pipelines e repositórios.Requisitos e qualificaçõesRequisitos para vaga:
Experiencia com FrontEnd, Angular 2+ ou React;
Proficiência para novosdesenvolvimentos e para entendimento de códigos existentes, bem como debugar aplicações e frontend na IDE e pelo F12 no browser;
Experiencia em desenvolvimento de WebApi .Net CoreEntityFrameworkInjeção de DependenciaDDDTestes unitáriosCandidato ambicioso, com vontade de crescer na carreira e força de vontade pra trabalhar/fazer horas extras.Experiencia com ferramentas de mensageria (RabbitMQ, Sqs, Sns, Kafka), preferencialmente RabbitMQExperiencia com sistemas distribuídos, com microserviços que interagem entre si;
Experiencia comalguma ferramenta de observabilidade/logs, como DataDog, azuremonitor;
CloudWatchBanco de dados não relacional (MongoDB, DynamoDB)Experiencia com ambiente de trabalho com estrutura de CI-CDExperiencia com pelo menos 3 ferramentas de Cloud(Exemplo:
Aws lambda, Azure functions, SQS, SNS, EC2)Experiencia com docker e kubernetes;
Experiencia ou conhecimento do Azure DevOpsSoft Skills:
Raciocínio lógico e capacidade analítica;
Boa Comunicação;
Espírito de equipe e capacidade de resolução de conflitos;
Ter capacidade de comunicação com diversos perfis de stakeholders;
Habilidade de trabalharem equipes ágeis e multidisciplinares;
Criatividade e Proatividade para imaginar diferentes cenários de uso das aplicações;

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (Remote)
description:
Remote (North America timezones)Maximus ( />// is a mission-driven consumer health company that provides men with content, community, and clinical support to optimize them in mind and body. Maximus has raised $15M from top Silicon Valley VCs such as Founders Fund and 8VC as well as leading angel investors/operators from companies like Bulletproof, Tinder, Coinbase, Daily Stoic, & Shopify.Maximus is building an advanced telemedicine platform to help men improve their mental and physical health. We iterate on our product rapidly and safely by applying continuous integration and code quality measurements, as well as TDD and pair programming when appropriate. We work collaboratively, emphasizing the productivity of the team first. We aim to deliver a robust, reliable system by using pragmatic, tried-and-true technologies. We hone our craft as engineers by applying advanced functional, data-oriented techniques that are appropriate to the problem.Please note:
Culture is key at Maximus, so we get to know candidates holistically through our questionnaire. You will receive an invite in a separate email upon submitting an application. Please fill it out as honestly and intuitively as possible since it is designed to detect exaggeration, which will cause your application to be automatically rejected. The questionnaire is optional to submit now with your application, but candidates that do so will get strongly prioritized. Note, we do not have access to individual questions’ answers/choices.Responsibilities:
Write and ship high quality code. Contribute across the codebase to complete entire features and changes with support from the rest of the team. Continuously invest in demonstrable quality and reliability of the system via unit tests, automated integration tests, TDD and refactoring. Keep data management and security in mind at all times to protect customer privacy.Contribute to a continuously improving engineering organization. Identify software quality, performance, and operational issues, including impediments to team-wide efficiency and work constructively with the team to address them. Define and improve our internal engineering standards and processes and exert positive influence on the objectives and tactics taken by the team.Contribute actively to product iteration and development to ensure the company delivers a compelling experience to its customers. Generate ideas and assess the associated options and tradeoffs for how they impact the growth of the business and customer experience. Work across functional teams (engineering, marketing, product, etc.) to translate business and product ideas into software designs and releases. Product & Project Management skills and experience are a plus.The ideal candidate will have the following:
Experience:
6+ years of experience in product software development, especially public consumer web applications.Front-end:
React/Redux/ImmutableJS experience.Back-end:
Ruby-on-Rails / Ruby experience.Ruby experience is highly preferred.General experience in unit testing, integration testing.Past experience or interest in pair programming.Nice to Have:
Familiarity with queue / background processing, 3rd party integrations (such as Stripe, or 3PL, etc.).Familiarity with or interest in Event Sourcing and other immutability / functional-programming patterns.TDD experience is a plus.Qualities:
A dedication to keeping things simple and pragmatic.Attitude of shared ownership of the system, frequent integration. Collaborates proactively, in service of the shared highest priority.Strong communication and teamwork skills:
Proven ability to build strong relationships with technical and non-technical members of the team to solve challenging technical and business problems.Relentlessly Resourceful:
highly proactive, does not quit, and finds innovative solutions with little guidance. Bias for action and ability to thrive in an ambiguous environment with a high degree of autonomy.Passion for Men’s Health & Development:
interest in helping men develop a healthy masculinity. Demonstrates personal dedication and interest in health optimization (e.G. diet, exercise, sleep, focus, and relationships).World-Class Benefits:
Premium Blue Shield Platinum PPO & HMO Plans (up to 80% coverage).Full Suite:
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance.Best-in-class 401K options.Flexible vacation/time-off policies.Liquidity of options whenever available.Extended options exercise window for loyal employees (3 months for every year of service;
e.G. 1 year for 4+ yearemployees).Maximus is an equal opportunity employer, which not only includes standard protected categories, but the additional freedom from discrimination against your free speech and beliefs, as long as they are aligned with company values. We celebrate intellectual diversity.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Técnica Automação/Instrumentação/Mecatrônica
description:
Venha para uma das maiores empresas de Serviços TI do mundo!! Aqui você pode transformar sua carreira! Por que fazer parte da TCS? Aqui na TCS acreditamos que as pessoas fazem a diferença, por isso vivemos uma cultura de aprendizado ilimitado cheio de oportunidades de melhorias e desenvolvimento mútuo. Emissão de requisiçãode transporte;

Conhecimento intermediário de pacote Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook e Teams). Conhecimento intermediário do módulo PM do SAP. Conhecimento intermediário do módulo MM do SAP. Conhecimento de APLAT. Desejável experiência em planejamento e programação de manutenção, principalmente offshore. O que você pode esperar de nós? - Desenvolvimento profissional e evolução constante das suas competências, sempre de acordo com os seus interesses.

title: Director Of Finance
description:
Company DescriptionRafflesis a brand among the Accor group. In most of its locations, Raffles has a long history of making the most of major landmarks, embedded in the local heritage of each country. Raffles Hotels create a well-balanced bridge between local communities, heritage, and the environment. Through the Raffles brands, the historical buildings enjoy a new life thanks to renovations that helped create refreshed luxurious accommodations that benefit from a better sustainable performance thanks to their new eco-design. These sensitive, high-quality, and sustainable repairs and enhancements are provided by the brand in areas of high historic significance.Job DescriptionThe Director of Finance is a key member of the property Executive Committee, offering professional, friendly and engaging service to Clients, Owners, Suppliers and fellow Colleagues.What you will be doing:
Analyzes and advises on business operations including revenue and expenditure trends, financial commitments and future revenues.Analyzes financial information to recommend or develop efficient use of resources and procedures;
provides strategic recommendations and maintain solutions to business and financial objectives.Works closely with the Hotel Ownership to provide business support and analysis as required.Leads and manages the Accounting,Purchasing, Receiving, stores and IT departments and ensures all standards are followed.Supports, guides and directs his team members by providing coaching with Colleague Relations insuring positive Colleague Engagement.Develops Colleague Engagement Survey Action Plans with team.Acting as a leader and role model in the adherence to all Accor standards, the successful candidate will exhibit Accor’s values at all times.Participates actively to the Executive Committee, Department Head and Revenue Management meetings and any other meetings as required.Participates actively in the preparation of annual Operating Budget, Rolling Forecast, Marketing & Sales Plan and Capital Budget as well as the Strategic Plan.Responsible for oversight of Hotel Capital process in conjunction with General Manager.Ensures labor management and other available tools are properly used by managers to set and monitor staffing levels and productivity targets with the goal of ensuring a balance between service and profitability.Ensures full compliance with Accor, IFRS and internal financial controls and seeks innovative ways to improve performance on a regular basis.Compiles and analyzes financial information to prepare financial statements including monthly and annual reports and ensures accurate and efficient monthly, quarterly and year- end results.Ensures all financial reporting deadlines are met.Ensures financial records are maintained in compliance with accepted policies and procedures.Establishes and monitors the implementation and maintenance of operational controls and strategies.Ensures cash flow is adequate to meet the needs of the operation. Approves all cash disbursements and ensures that all disbursements are properly documented and executed. Approves all rebates, adjustments and allowances in accordance with Accor policy.Oversees of Budget and Forecast activities and assists Departmental Leaders as required through financial training and mentoring.Ensures accurate and appropriate recording and analysis of revenues and expenses.Protects Accor and the Hotel Ownership`s interests in the Hotel assets and operations, including liaison with Corporate Legal and Risk Management when the need arises.Other duties as assigned.QualificationsSenior Financial Leader with a minimum of 5 years’ experience with preference given to candidates with hotel / hospitality leadership.Computer literate with complex accounting software and other tools such as Microsoft applications and relevant computer applications.Excellent communication and organizational skills.Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities.Highly responsible & reliable with exceptional attention to detail.Ability to work cohesively as part of a team.Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times.Additional InformationCompetenciesGood interpersonal skills with ability to communicate with all levels of colleagues.Service oriented with an eye for details.Multicultural awareness and able to work and thrive within a culturally diverse environment.Good presentation and influencing skills.Flexible and able to embrace and respond to change effectively.Ability to work independently and has good initiative under dynamic environment.Self-motivated and energetic.Leads to constantly improve the guest and colleague service experience.Leadership skills required – collaborative, enabling, and entrepreneurial.Demonstrates sophistication, humbleness, personality, charisma, confidence, professional etiquette and competencies.Why work for Accor?We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit />//careers.Accor.Com/Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Assistente De Contabilidade/Financeiro
description:
O assistente de contabilidade/financeiro irá dar suporte à nossa equipe nas rotinas das áreas.Responsabilidades e atribuiçõesRotina Contábil:
classificação, lançamentos e participação na emissão de relatórios contábeis, conciliações, planilhas de controle desaldos e composições, controle de ativo e seus respectivos cálculos. Auxiliar nos processos de suporte aos setores contábil, fiscal,auditoria;
Rotina Fiscal:
realizar o preenchimento e conferência das obrigações acessórias (Sped Contribuições, DCTF, DIRF, REINF e DCTFWEB) e apuração de impostos e emissão das guias (IRPJ, CSLL, PIS, COFINS, IRRF, CSRF, ICMS, ISS, INSS). Emissão de notasfiscais. Suporte no envio das obrigações acessórias. Acompanhamento da legislação tributária e identificação de oportunidades e riscos;
Rotina Financeira:
lançamento e análise das operações de contas a pagar e a receber, suporte na elaboração de relatórios gerencias efinanceiros.Requisitos e qualificaçõesCursando a partir do 7º período Ciências Contábeis, ou formado com o CRC ativo (Experiência de 1 ano CLT.)Excel IntermediárioDiferencial:
Domínio sistemas e oriundo de escritório contábilConhecimento em rotina contábil, fiscal e financeiraInformações adicionaisBenefícios:
Vale Transporte - Transporte público convencional;
Vale Refeição;
Day off no aniversário;
Academia (de acordo coma disponibilidade);

title: E Designer Ux Ui Pleno
description:
Netvagas Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, BrazilA Extreme Digital Solutions é uma empresa jovem, fundada em 2014, antenada nas mais modernas tendências e tecnologias.Temos como missão tornar negócios mais simples e eficientes, buscando e integrando soluções para as mais complexas e diversas necessidades dos nossos clientes.Ao longo do tempo, atingimos a marca de 1000 colaboradores no Brasil e realizamos centenas de projetos desafiadores, com uso intenso de inteligência artificial, sempre com foco na experiência do usuário e no sucesso do cliente.Fazer parte da EDS é uma oportunidade de atuar em uma empresa que gosta de inovar e assumir riscos. Somos aventureiros e gostamos disso!Nosso time de talentos busca pessoas que queiram crescer e entregar resultados surpreendentes.Estamos procurando um Designer UX com habilidades técnicas no uso do Figma, entendimento sólido de design e prototipagem, e que esteja sempre aprendendo. É essencial ter experiência com design de interfaces e UX, além de criar protótipos interativos. Conhecimentos básicos de HTML e CSS são um diferencial. Não esqueça de incluir seu portfólio!RequisitosProficiência em ferramentas de design e prototipagem, especialmente Figma.Compreensão de Design e Prototipagem.Conhecimento em metodologias de design centrado no usuário e práticas de pesquisa de usuário.Habilidades de Design de Interfaces e Experiência do Usuário (UX).Habilidades de comunicação e capacidade de apresentar ideias de design de forma clara e eficaz.Experiência em conduzir testes de usabilidade e análise de feedback.Familiaridade com design responsivo e princípios de acessibilidade.Conhecimento de REACT, HTML, CSS e JavaScript é um diferencial.Outras informaçõesCondições PJ:
valor fixo e 10 dias de ausência remunerada.Benefícios oferecidos:
Check-in premiado:
cada ida ao escritório gera um número da sorte para concorrer a prêmios semanais, mensais e anuais.Aulas de inglês gratuitas ministradas por professores qualificados até 2x na semana.Serviços de bem-estar e saúde, como manicure, barbearia, massagem e cabelereiro.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Redator Freelance Em Português (Brasil)
description: A Outlier ajuda as empresas mais inovadoras do mundo a melhorar seus modelos de inteligência artificial fornecendo feedback humano. Você é um redator experiente em português que gostaria de usar sua experiência para treinar modelos de inteligência artificial?Sobre a OportunidadeA Outlier está em busca de redatores talentosos com fluência em português para ajudar a treinar modelos de inteligência artificial generativa.Esta oportunidade freelance é remota e oferece horários flexíveis, para que você possa trabalhar no horário que for melhor para você.Como você pode contribuirLer textos em português (Brasil) para classificar uma série de respostas geradas por um modelo de IA.Escrever uma história curta em português (Brasil) sobre um tópico específico.Avaliar se um texto em português (Brasil) gerado por um modelo de IA é factualmente correto.Exemplos De Experiência DesejávelExperiência como tradutor profissional.Experiência profissional em redação (redator publicitário, jornalista, redator técnico, editor, etc.).Inscrição ou conclusão de um curso de graduação em humanidades ou em um campo relacionado à escrita.Inscrição ou conclusão de um programa de pós-graduação relacionado à escrita criativa.PagamentoAtualmente, a remuneração média para o trabalho principal realizado por especialistas em redação em português (Brasil) é de USD $10 por hora.As tarifas podem variar com base na experiência, avaliação de habilidades, localização, necessidade do projeto e outros fatores. Por exemplo, tarifas mais altas podem ser oferecidas para PhDs. Para trabalhos não principais, como durante o processo inicial de integração ao projeto ou fases de horas extras, podem ser aplicadas tarifas mais baixas. Alguns projetos oferecem pagamentos por incentivos. Revise os termos de pagamento de cada projeto.Get notified about new Freelance Writer jobs in Greater Rio de Janeiro.Criador(A) De Conteúdo Juridico Com Foco Em Seo + Ia + Impacto#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior Developer
description:
Join to apply for the Senior Developer role at Findex1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Senior Developer role at FindexDream big, build bigger—join Findex as a Senior Developer and transform the tech world!Join our Digital team as a Senior Developer and work in an agile environment where you'll have the opportunity to deliver innovative, cutting-edge solutions that our customers love.This is a full-time, permanent, remote opportunity for someone ideally based in Brazil or Argentina.What will your typical week look like?Be involved with the expansion of our internal libraries for reusable application development.Take part in sprints, executions, retrospectives, and backlog grooming.Drive the product development direction by providing technical and non-technical feedback on the product backlog.Ensure the development follows system and solution architectures in support of the product roadmap and company vision.More about the perks!Flexible working arrangements to suit your work-life balance!Opportunities to continue advancing your career development!Access to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to support your overall well-being.You will be provided with ongoing training and support opportunities including a dedicated buddy!Let’s talk about you! You are..CEFR Level B2 English or better.A seasoned Developer who has proven commercial experience working within a product oriented team!Have knowledge of 'Serverless' technologies such as AWS S3, AWS Lambda, AWS SAM, and Serverless Framework is encouraged.A key player in delivering product deployments, using industry standard CI/CD tools and IaC.Let’s talk about our team!We are passionate about creating fintech software for our internal stakeholders and the wider financial services market!Passionate about working together to create new value and help people thrive!Be involved in our fun events such as DigiTech Day, Dungeons & Dragons game nights, or immerse in the discussion of the future of technology and its role in society in our Streams.About us!With a passion for well-being, Findex adopts a dynamic working environment and empowers our people to operate from wherever they find themselves most engaged, productive, and collaborative, while leveraging a flexible blend of remote and in-office work.At Findex we are passionate about what we do and how we do it. Are you a big and bold thinker? Do you like to make meaningful change? Are you motivated by working in a business that puts clients first and embraces teamwork?If this sounds like you, we look forward to meeting you. Apply now!PLEASE NOTE:
Only candidates with valid working rights will be considered.Findex is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and encourage applications from candidates with a variety of strengths, backgrounds and experiences.Note for Recruitment Agencies:
This role is being managed by Findex Talent Acquisition and we will not accept unsolicited resumes/applications from Recruitment Agencies.Seniority levelSeniority levelMid-Senior levelEmployment typeEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionJob functionEngineering and FinanceIndustriesFinancial Services and Software DevelopmentReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at Findex by 2xGet notified about new Software Engineer jobs in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.Full Stack React.Js & C# Engineer - Work from homeJoin Klar’s Talent Pool – Software Engineers (Remote - LATAM)We’re unlocking community knowledge in a new way. Experts add insights directly into each article, started with the help of AI.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Medical Scientific Liaison - Rio De Janeiro - Rj
description:
Medical Scientific Liaison - Rio de Janeiro - RJBewerben locationsAmericas, BR, Remote, CSL ViforTime TypeVollzeitPosted OnGesternJob Requisition IDR-252803The Opportunity:
Reporting to the Medical Affairs Manager, as the Medical Scientific Liaison, you will represent Medical Affairs externally to establish and maintain medical relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs), HCPs and key accounts on behalf of Vifor Pharma Group. You will execute country medical plans locally by representing the medical expertise in TAs and products and through scientific engagement with the medical community. You will provide disease state education, medical information and research support and share scientific insights from medical community interactions with local and global medical teams, ensuring the capture of field medical expertise. Also, train colleagues internally, all in accordance with global and local compliance and regulations. The ideal Candidate will need to reside in Rio de Janeiro in order to be considered.The Role:
Develop and maintain scientific and medical expertise (TAs and products)Identify, develop and maintain relationships with KOLs, HCPs and professional organizations.KOL engagement, key account medical support, training and other appropriate activities.Facilitate scientific engagement, scientific exchange and medical information.Provide Disease State Education, clinical presentations and respond to medical requests.Update medical team and other internal stakeholders on medical community interactions.Partner with sales team to ensure consistent and updated products information is shared with the HCPs.Provide medical support for patient and formulary access products following global and local policies and procedures.Support the development, implementation and completion of medical activities (advisory boards, congress symposia, hospital meetings and speaker programs).Serve as a medical resource for internal medical and sales training.Support company sponsored clinical research and IIS process.Attend relevant scientific meetings and conferences and support development of summaries of key data, presentations or symposium.Ensure compliance with applicable local and global laws, regulations, guidelines and company policies and procedures.Develop personal and professional capabilities to improve skills and professional capabilities.Your Skills and Experience:
University degree in Medical or Life Science Field (e.G. Medicine, Pharmacy, Biology/ Biochemistry)Minimum of 3 years' experience in clinical practice, research or pharmaceutical industryDemonstrated experience in KOL, HCP or medical community engagementExcellent oral and written communication skills in Portuguese;
experience with digitalcommunication;
good oral and written communication skills in EnglishExperience in public scientific presentationsAbility for overnight travel, up to 50%About CSL ViforCSL Vifor aims to become the global leader in iron deficiency and nephrology.The company is a partner of choice for pharmaceuticals and innovative patient-focused solutions across iron, dialysis, nephrology and rare conditions. CSL Vifor strives to help patients around the world with severe, chronic and rare diseases lead better, healthier lives. It specializes in strategic global partnering, in-licensing and developing, manufacturing and marketing pharmaceutical products for precision patient care.For more information, please visit viforpharma.ComWe want CSL to reflect the world around usAs a global organization with employees in 35+ countries, CSL embraces diversity and inclusion. Learn more about Diversity & Inclusion at CSL.Do work that matters at CSL Vifor!#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Qa (Quality Assurance) Analyst 964788
description:
A Dexian, lançada em 2023, tem presença global e traz consigo quase 30 anos de experiência através de suas companhias legadas, principalmente da combinação da DISYS e Signature Consultants.Iniciamos no Brasil 2007 como DISYS e, de lá para cá, conquistamos mais de 60 clientes de diferentes setores da economia. Como Dexian, passamos a ser uma das maiores empresas de soluções de staffing, soluções de TI e complementação de força de trabalho. Estamos liderando a indústria por meio de entrega de serviços exclusivos que combina escala global, projetos de serviço completo e agilidade tática para modernizar modelos de contratação. Apoiamos nossos clientes para encontrar a melhor maneira que seu gap de talentos seja endereçado, de maneira a suportar seu processo de transformação digital. Contamos com escritórios estrategicamente localizados em quatro grandes capitais:
Curitiba (PR), Porto Alegre (RS), Rio de Janeiro (RJ) e São Paulo (SP). Assim, conseguimos nos manter próximos dos nossos clientes e consultores. Também somos uma Minority Owner Company e nos sentimos orgulhosos de termos nascido na diversidade.O que esperar de nósPessoas estão no centro de nossa estratégia e compõem o nosso maior capital. Temos compromisso de atrair, reter os melhores talentos e construir conexões reais para a vida. Por isso, atuamos como ponte entre profissionais altamente qualificados e oportunidades consistentes e prósperas. Acreditamos que, trazer o talento, a tecnologia e as organizações certas juntos, ajuda a desbloquear resultados transformadores e alcançar novos níveis de sucessos para os clientes que atendemos e os consultores que contratamos. E para isso, cinco valores fundamentais nos guiam:
Integridade, Transparência, Autenticidade, Engenhosidade e Empatia. A Dexian está comprometida com a responsabilidade social corporativa e, investe em programas que apoiam a diversidade e inclusão.Se você compartilha dos mesmos valores, aqui é seu lugar!Nosso Cliente:
Esta vaga irá atender nosso cliente, uma grande multinacional no segmento de petróleo e gás.Perfil Profissional – QA/Test AnalystFormação Acadêmica:
Graduação em Ciência da Computação, Tecnologia da Informação, Engenharia ou áreas correlatas.Inglês fluente, com capacidade de comunicação em ambientes globais.Soft Skills:
Priorização:
Habilidade em identificar tarefas críticas, otimizando o tempo e os recursos para alcançar resultados com eficiência.Adaptabilidade:
Flexibilidade para se ajustar rapidamente a mudanças em requisitos, escopo e tecnologias.Comunicação:
Excelente comunicação verbal e escrita, com facilidade para interagir com equipes técnicas, áreas de negócio e stakeholders de diferentes níveis.Diversidade:
Capacidade de colaborar com pessoas de diferentes culturas e localizações, promovendo um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e global.Habilidades Técnicas:
Desenvolvimento e manutenção de planos de teste e cenários de validação.Experiência com ferramentas de automação de testes, como Tosca e Selenium.Execução de testes unitários, regressão, performance e stress.Conhecimento em APIs e testes de integração.Conhecimentos básicos em:
C#SQLCloud (AWS)GitHubVivência em metodologias ágeis (Agile) e trabalho colaborativo em squads.Experiência com testes de aplicações mobile.

title: Especialista I Comunicação Corporativa
description:
O cargo tem como função principal o controle e coordenação das Operações da Comunicação Corporativa da Nissan do Brasil, dando suporte a gerente de Comunicação, com o objetivo de contribuir para a gestão, controle financeiro (budget, pagamentos, sistemas) e dos fornecedores, ser responsável pela organização dos Eventos e logística para estabelecer e fortalecer o relacionamento da companhia com os principais públicos-alvo, trabalhando em conjunto e de maneira cross funcional com as outras áreas da Comunicação Corporativa (PR e Comunicação Interna) e das diretorias Financeira, de Compras, MKT e Jurídico, entre outras.Responsabilidades:
Ser responsável pelo desenvolvimento e realização dos eventos que envolvam as áreas de Imprensa (PR) e Comunicação Interna da NBA.Fazer e acompanhar o controle financeiro da área de Comunicação Corporativa (M&S e G&A) e contratação de fornecedores.Criação de controles e processos para a organização financeira, de gestão e de eventos da Comunicação.Elaborar em conjunto com a hierarquia da área e revisar periodicamente o orçamento da área de Comunicação Corporativa (PR, Comunicação Interna e Operações).Responsável pelos processos de cadastros e validações no fluxo de pagamentos (criação de ER, material de suporte para validações financeiras em approval meetings, documentos RC, inclusão e gestão do SAP e geração de PO).Identificar, selecionar e estabelecer contratos com fornecedores que contribuam para tornar as ações de Comunicação mais eficientes, entregando resultados com qualidade e otimizando o budget da companhia. Função exercida trabalhando em conjunto com as equipes Financeira e de Compras.Controlar e alinhar as atividades das agências de eventos, fornecedores e parceiros da Comunicação Corporativa visando melhorar a operação, reduzir custos e aumentar a eficiência em termos de qualidade e entregas.Realizar relatórios de mensuração de resultado das ações com o objetivo de registro e melhoria contínua.Ser a interface da Comunicação Corporativa com as equipes das diretorias afins para o trabalho de Operações, como Marketing, Financeiro, Compras e Jurídico.Prospecção de sinergias com outras diretorias e com a Renault em relação a fornecedores da área de Comunicação.Planejamento de viagens e domínio do sistema de solicitação de aéreos e hospedagens.Controles e manutenção dos insumos da área (material institucional) para atendimento dos itens de suporte as ações da Comunicação.Benchmarking em relação à concorrência como referência e incorporação das melhores práticas e desempenhos de outras firmas e/ou parceiros em gestão e eventos próprios.Localização:
Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brasil#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Maitre
description:
Descrição da empresaNo Fairmont Rio de Janeiro Copacabana você viverá uma experiência única e incomparável durante sua hospedagem em Copacabana, seja a passeio ou a trabalho. Aproveite os serviços de spa, sauna, massagem e salão de beleza do nosso Fairmont SPA e a piscina com borda infinita para revitalizar as energias. O hotel de luxo conta também com café, bar com mixologia e um delicioso restaurante especializado em frutos do mar, além de salas para reuniões e eventos e uma bela vista panorâmica do Rio de Janeiro.O hotel 5 estrelas está situado na Avenida Atlântica, próximo às praias de Copacabana e Ipanema, além do Recanto do Museu e do Forte de Copacabana, que estão a 8 minutos a pé do hotel. Conheça os sabores dos deliciosos restaurantes e bares de Copacabana enquanto aprecia cada momento da viagem em um dos bairros mais famosos da zona sul do Rio de Janeiro, conhecido por suas ruas boêmias e poéticas, que até hoje servem de inspiração para os mais diversos artistas criarem suas músicas, livros e poesias.Na hora de decidir o que fazer no Rio de Janeiro, lembre-se de incluir no roteiro o Museu do Amanhã, a lagoa Rodrigo de Freitas e o Museu de Arte Moderna. Usufrua de toda a riqueza e graciosidade da região e eternize a cidade maravilhosa dentro de você!Descrição da vagaResponsável pela realização de eventos sociais e banquetes, estabelecendo diretrizes de forma a garantir o alinhamento à estratégia estabelecida, a fidelização dos clientes e o contínuo crescimento comercial do negócio. Garantir que a equipe siga os padrões e políticas da empresa, organizando o trabalho com uso de check-lists e supervisionando a higiene, segurança alimentar e controle de estoques. Atuar na coordenação de mise en place, atendimento, gestão de pessoal e controle de qualidade dos serviços. Conduzir treinamentos periódicos e acompanhar a satisfação dos clientes. Apoiar no gerenciamento de requisições, conservação de materiais e promover comunicação diária com a equipe. Entre outras atividades relativas à função.QualificaçõesInglês Fluente;
Experiência anterior nafunção em hotéis ou restaurante de luxo;
Amplo conhecimento e aplicação das boas práticas de segurança alimentar;
Conhecimento de etiqueta à mesa e serviços.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Analista Negocios Sr
description:
A Prudential é uma empresa global com 150 anos de história, presente em mais de 50 países. Há mais de 27 anos, ajudamos a minimizar o impacto financeiro de imprevistos na vida de famílias brasileiras. Somos a maior seguradora independente no segmento de vida, com crescimento médio de 27% em faturamento nos últimos 10 anos, e lideramos o mercado oferecendo soluções inovadoras e personalizadas de seguros de vida individual e em grupo.Somos uma subsidiária da Prudential Financial, líder multinacional de serviços financeiros com 150 anos de mercado, atuando nos Estados Unidos, Ásia, Europa e América Latina. Nosso canal de vendas inclui franqueados, parcerias comerciais e corretores altamente capacitados.Para saber mais sobre a Prudential do Brasil, visite nosso site.Venha fazer parte da nossa equipe!Informações sobre a oportunidade:
Desafios da posição:
Gerenciar projetos estratégicos de alta complexidade, garantindo entregas dentro do prazo, escopo e orçamento;
Atuar como ponte entre áreas de negócio e tecnologia, traduzindo necessidades em requisitos claros;
Mapear processos existentes e propor melhorias contínuas;
Elaborar especificaçõesfuncionais detalhadas e apoiar soluções técnicas;
Conduzir processos de homologação, validando entregas e garantindo aderência às expectativas;
Manter comunicação constante com áreas de negócio e liderança, apresentando relatórios de status;
O que estes desafios irão demandar de você:
Forte capacidade analítica e atenção a detalhes;
Habilidade de organização e gestão de múltiplos projetos;
Boa comunicaçãooral e escrita;
Visão estratégica e habilidade para propor soluções práticas;
Proatividade naidentificação de riscos.Desejáveis:
Experiência no mercado de seguros;
Certificações como PMP,Scrum Master (CSM) ou Product Owner (CSPO);
Experiência commetodologias ágeis (Scrum, Kanban) e ferramentas como Jira, Confluence, MS Project;
Formação em lean sigma.Requisitos básicos:
Graduação em Administração, Engenharia, Tecnologia da Informação ou áreas correlatas;
Sólida experiência em gestão de projetos (PMBOK, Ágil, híbridos) e atuação como Product Owner;
Levantamento derequisitos, documentação de especificações e homologação;
Perfil dinâmico, colaborativo e foco em resultados;
MS Office avançado;
Inglês intermediário.Trabalhamos em modelo híbrido (3 dias no escritório e 2 dias remotos) no Rio de Janeiro.Benefícios:
Assistência médica e odontológicaVale refeição e alimentaçãoAuxílio creche ou babáPrevidência privadaSeguro de vida em grupoParticipação nos lucrosLicença maternidade e paternidade estendidaBem-Estar:
Viver Bem+:
telemedicina, telepsicoterapia, coaching nutricional e esportivoReembolso em eventos esportivosShiatsu nos escritóriosApoio financeiro, jurídico e psicológicoPrograma Fully de bem-estar e recompensasWellhubFolga no aniversárioHorário flexívelNós desenvolvemos você! Oferecemos treinamentos, autonomia e crescimento, promovendo bem-estar com ações internas de qualidade de vida.Nós valorizamos você! Reconhecemos iniciativas, incentivamos o protagonismo, valorizamos a diversidade e somos uma empresa inclusiva. Candidatos de todas as características pessoais serão considerados.#J-18808-Ljbffr

Supervisionar as equipes de instalação e produção.Acompanhar medições, instalações e andamento das obras.Organizar e distribuir atividades diárias para os colaboradores.Planejar e monitorar cronogramas, prazos e entregas.Realizar controle de materiais, estoque e solicitar compras quando necessário.Acompanhar a qualidade dos serviços, garantindo padrão de entrega e satisfação dos clientes.Resolver problemas operacionais e técnicos que surgirem nas obras ou no processo produtivo.Alinhar informações com a equipe administrativa e comercial.Requisitos:
Experiência anterior como supervisor, encarregado ou líder no ramo de vidraçaria, construção civil ou similares.Conhecimento em leitura de projetos e medições.Habilidade em liderança e gestão de pessoas.Boa comunicação, organização e proatividade.CNH categoria B (obrigatório)Diferenciais:
Conhecimento técnico em instalação de vidros temperados, fachadas, box, espelhos, guarda-corpo e envidraçamento de sacada.Cursos em gestão, logística ou segurança do trabalho (NR-35)Oferecemos:

description:
